column1: The United States has hit another record high number of daily COVID-19 cases. It is more important than ever to ensure you are keeping yourself and others safe. Take the necessary precautions: wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands. https://t.co/ukxpAzXuUu
This is welcome news in the fight against the #coronavirus but we cannot let our guard down.  Please remember to wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands. https://t.co/ZGiyGKALGM
My office continuously updates our website with resources and information regarding the #coronavirus. If you need any assistance please don’t hesitate to reach out. https://t.co/LNLDPrhiAk

#CA39 residents who might need a coronavirus test can find their nearest testing site below.  LA County: https://t.co/QiajEaTHp1 Orange County: https://t.co/inZNetbKwt San Bernardino County: https://t.co/beGGWe0Idh

Yesterday the U.S. reported the most #COVID_19 cases in a single day since the start of this pandemic. Remember to wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands. This pandemic is not over please keep yourself and those around you safe. https://t.co/TY8dOQO6M7

Since April I've been advocating for relief for our state and local governments. The updated #HeroesAct provides the funding and support our states and cities need to fight the coronavirus and distribute the vaccine.  https://t.co/DXGzpVWOXh

Applications for the Orange County COVID-19 Child Care Relief Grants are now open. Child care providers in need of assistance can find more information and apply at https://t.co/zdwhTZ8o0h. The application period closes November 13th.

#Covid19 has made it clearer than ever that everyone needs high-speed broadband. Instead of abandoning families and students struggling to get Internet access Congress should restore #NetNeutrality and ensure everyone has access to reliable affordable broadband. https://t.co/Qv5vLslrOv

Families are struggling to put food on the table small businesses need help and we're reaching daily records of COVID-19 infections. Instead of passing COVID relief the Senate rushed a SCOTUS Justice 8 days before the election. That should tell you where their priorities lie. https://t.co/A6pZXgolyD

On Friday the U.S. hit its highest one-day number of #COVID19 infections. This pandemic is not over. Please remember to wear a mask practice social distancing and wash your hands. https://t.co/eVmaTIPeYq

There is a rise in coronavirus cases throughout the country. Now more than ever we need to enact a national strategy for testing and contact tracing to get this virus under control and keep our communities safe. https://t.co/s6qPXpGs3s

The #COVID_19 crisis has created a range of new opportunities for fraud scams and fake cures. Below you can find resources on how to spot COVID-19 scams and who to contact if you or someone you know may have been affected. https://t.co/wM1G9WuByc

Coronavirus cases in the US are rising again. The updated #HeroesAct includes funding to improve and expand our testing tracing and treatment efforts. We need a national strategy to get control of this pandemic. https://t.co/dIkIcRdf3D

The city of #BuenaPark is holding walk up #COVID_19 testing at city hall today until 7pm PST.  See below to locate your nearest testing site. Orange County: https://t.co/B7pJ6BuPep LA County: https://t.co/QiajEaTHp1 San Bernardino County: https://t.co/beGGWe0Idh

This Tuesday I am hosting a #CisnerosInYourDistrict virtual town hall to provide coronavirus updates and answer your questions. Join me at 6pm PST for our 30th #CA39 town hall! RSVP here: https://t.co/qSKakjoVT1 https://t.co/t4OLSfhVac

The US on Thursday reported more than 56000 new confirmed cases of COVID-19 making it the country’s highest daily increase since mid-August.  We must remain vigilant by continuing to wear a mask practicing social distancing and washing your hands.  https://t.co/PvYNEVTGqJ

THREAD: Instead of focusing on passing coronavirus relief Sen. Mitch McConnell is pulling out all the stops to pass a SCOTUS Justice. We’re already in the middle of an election and the Senate should wait to vote on a new Justice until after Inauguration Day. https://t.co/IyhkFVz8Q4

The Strategic National Stockpile needs major improvements to ensure frontline workers cities and states have the necessary supplies to fight #COVID_19 and future crises. The Senate must pass the updated #HeroesAct to replenish and strengthen the SNS and keep our country safe.

Next week I am hosting my 30th #CA39 town hall! Join me on Oct. 13 at 6pm PST for #CisnerosInYourDistrict where I'll discuss coronavirus updates and answer your questions. Space is limited RSVP is required: https://t.co/qSKakjoVT1 https://t.co/ceemY0L0Cj

#COVID_19 has worsened the affordable housing crisis in CA & across the country. I joined @RepKenMarchant & @RepKClark in introducing a bipartisan bill to expand & improve access to affordable housing while creating jobs & promoting economic activity. https://t.co/LMyydQtOLo

#COVID_19 has disproportionately affected communities of color in #CA39 and throughout the country. California's new measures are an important step in addressing these health disparities. https://t.co/O4LA7QxIbP

The 5th round of the LA Regional COVID Recovery Fund Grant program has started accepting applications. Small businesses and non profits in #LACounty can apply below. For more info visit https://t.co/4Np2AmL11m

I've been advocating for greater federal support for contact tracing and testing nationwide. The updated #HeroesAct provides $75 billion to establish a #COVID_19 National Testing and Contact Tracing Initiative. We must ensure everyone has access to free testing and treatment.

Praying for a safe and speedy recovery for the President and First Lady.   It's a reminder that we all have a part to play to slow the spread of the coronavirus. Follow CDC guidelines wear a mask wash your hands and continue to practice social distancing.

The shortage of PPE was unacceptable & hindered our frontline workers' ability to keep themselves safe.  The bipartisan Strengthening America's Strategic National Stockpile Act ensures that doesn't happen again by providing the resources needed to fight COVID-19 & future crises. https://t.co/GVEKdT9Iez

Latinos are disproportionately impacted by COVID-19—both by the virus itself and its economic consequences. This Hispanic Heritage Month we can’t hide from that reality. It’s not enough to celebrate Latino culture if we are not working to protect Latino lives. #HHM

I joined my Republican and Democratic colleagues in urging House leadership to bring a new bipartisan #COVID_19 relief bill to the House floor.  Just because the Senate can’t do its job doesn’t mean we can’t do ours. Families in #CA39 and across the country need relief. https://t.co/13XEE2bIrm

We mourn the 200000 lives lost to the #coronavirus. It's a tragic painful milestone for the U.S. We need a stronger COVID-19 response including a national testing and contact tracing strategy in order to get this crisis under control. https://t.co/PHBFMtgXAN

#LACounty childcare businesses that have been impacted by the #coronavirus may be eligible for a relief grant. Application period is open now till Friday Sept. 25th. For more information on LA County's Childcare Provider Grant program visit https://t.co/4IcKZ0XJR9. https://t.co/LTpXdf91ro

The #AAPI community has been essential in fighting this pandemic. Yet there are too many stories in #CA39 & the US of racism & discrimination toward Asian Americans.  I voted for a resolution to condemn anti-Asian sentiment related to COVID-19 & stand up for our AAPI community https://t.co/dmF0aQnDVC

The US has a narrow window to force the coronavirus into a partial retreat before the one-two punch of school openings & colder weather brings a widely feared rebound.  We need a national testing/contact tracing strategy. We can't afford to go backwards. https://t.co/cdgxMo4gbd

#COVID_19 has created an increased burden on schools providing meals for students. I advocated for the extension of the school meal waivers but our schools need more support especially with how they distribute meals. We must ensure no child goes hungry. https://t.co/7Rj9j1EhW5
#LACounty's Great Plates Delivered program has been extended to October 9th.  Qualifying older adults and adults over 60 at high risk for #COVID_19 can apply below: https://t.co/7jKkzft1WH

This is unacceptable especially as some states reopen schools. We need a national testing strategy and the Senate needs to pass the #HeroesAct which expands coronavirus testing. Families shouldn't have to struggle to get their kids tested. https://t.co/mUce6j4fXV

Latinos are disproportionately affected by the #coronavirus and we have to do more to close this disparity. This means improving outreach reducing language barriers and increasing access to resources. https://t.co/0JUqckzJcz

Starting today #LaHabra residents can apply for the city's Emergency Rental Assistance Program. The program will provide aid to individuals and families facing economic hardship due to the #coronavirus pandemic. Find more information here: https://t.co/7KJSFhIwNS https://t.co/uPjBhHxImF

This #LaborDay we remember all who have fought for workers’ rights from the shop floor in the streets and on the picket line.   I will continue fighting for American workers — especially during this #COVID_19 pandemic. https://t.co/QXw28o0PoX

As the father of 2 six-year-old boys I share the concerns of many parents seeing the rise of #COVIDー19 cases in children.   In July I urged the NIH to increase research on the impact of COVID on children. We need to do more to better protect our kids. https://t.co/eZQI6Q5BhM

There is a heat advisory in effect this weekend. Stay safe and stay cool utilizing the cooling centers throughout #CA39. Due to concerns regarding the coronavirus residents are encouraged to call ahead. Find the closest one to you below:  #LACounty: https://t.co/oBMWJIhzro (1/2)

ICYMI: I urged the Trump Administration to develop a national plan to equitably distribute the #COVID_19 vaccine before one is ready. We must have a strategic approach to ensure those at risk of transmission have access to a vaccine. https://t.co/fEpRvI4Ie9

The U.S. has more than 6 million #coronavirus cases. We need to step up our response—a national testing and contact tracing strategy PPE for frontline workers relief for small businesses schools cities & states and rent/mortgage relief. #HeroesAct https://t.co/Dhv7RraXRC

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! Our nation is experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/9o2fp4UHNo

Grant applications for Round 4 of the LA Regional #COVID_19 Recovery Fund are currently open for #LACounty small businesses and non-profits. Applications close September 4th. For more information on eligibility and to apply visit https://t.co/4Np2AmL11m

California's blueprint for reducing #COVID_19 includes industry-wide guidelines and county specific information. To find out how the new state guidelines impact #CA39 and which businesses can open visit https://t.co/aPKJtwGpoT
We all have a part to play in slowing the spread of the #coronavirus. Continue to wear a mask in public maintain social distancing and practice safe hygiene habits. https://t.co/n1pcr303HM

The CDC recently changed its testing guidelines suggesting that not all those exposed to #COVID_19 need to be tested. This is alarming. Widespread testing is crucial to our public health and safety. My colleagues & I sent a letter to the CDC demanding answers for this change. https://t.co/mse6JLiSd3

Our healthcare workers have long experienced high levels of stress and burnout and #COVID_19 has only made it worse.  My colleagues and I introduced bipartisan legislation to provide the mental health support and resources our healthcare heroes deserve. https://t.co/nl6kNJRf4U

Tomorrow I will be joining @WeAreUnidosUS for a webinar to discuss the effects of #COVID_19 on California's Latinx students. You can join us by registering here: https://t.co/kKXxtP5GSZ https://t.co/ZDoIn2aGHT

Local #OrangeCounty restaurants are encouraged to apply for $1000 grants through the SafeDineOC program to provide PPE and other resources for restaurants to promote #COVID_19 safety. For more information visit https://t.co/lPZF3oXh6y https://t.co/XIC1dgl7Lw

Today I joined my colleagues in calling on the Administration to create a #COVID_19 vaccine distribution plan that promotes health equity.  We cannot wait until the vaccine is ready to start thinking about distribution objectives or scramble to create plans last minute. https://t.co/1IxwroHd5x

Coronavirus cases are rising in children and the lack of widespread testing prevents us from knowing the true rate of infection in children. I'm fighting to expand testing to keep our children and our community safe and healthy. https://t.co/cCKjC0nlXH

The Latino community has been disproportionately affected by the #coronavirus. Misinformation and the lack of resources increase the health disparities they face. We must ensure the Latino community has access to accurate info and the resources they need. https://t.co/D5PqH4nEDa

The House passed 2 bipartisan child care bills 2 weeks ago which included my bill to keep child care centers safe. I joined my colleagues in urging congressional leadership to include these bills in the next COVID package. Child care is key to our economic recovery. https://t.co/Me7gDlUwtr

#Walnut small business owners: The Walnut Small Business Recovery Grant Program is now accepting applications to assist businesses struggling due to the #coronavirus. Find more info below ⤵️ https://t.co/9xp17dVvN0

Last night concluded my #CisnerosInYourCounty Town Halls for #CA39 residents and my 20th and 21st coronavirus town hall. Thanks to everyone who tuned in!   If you still have questions or need assistance please reach out to my office. https://t.co/XLWiARZ2NO

I've been calling for more funding for our state and local governments for months. We will not be able to recover if we allow our cities and states to go under. It's why we included funding for them in the #HeroesAct so they can get the support they need to combat COVID-19. https://t.co/utBEpcBA3k

The National Guard plays an instrumental role in COVID-19 response and recovery. I joined more than 115 of my colleagues in sending a bipartisan letter to the President urging for full federal funding for the National Guard in all states and territories. https://t.co/S1nK66169g

Thank you to everyone who joined me for our LA and San Bernardino #CisnerosInYourCounty Town Hall last night!   Cisneros In Your County is continuing tonight at 6pm PT for #OrangeCounty residents. RSVP here to get your questions about #COVID_19 answered. https://t.co/oQBrtObzG5 https://t.co/W9WwbkI854

#CA39 Orange County residents: tomorrow at 6:00 pm PT I will be hosting another #CisnerosInYourCounty Town Hall to provide updates on the #coronavirus and answer any questions you may have. RSVP here: https://t.co/oQBrtNTYhv https://t.co/H4y9FA3v55

You can’t fight #COVID19 without testing and contact tracing. This is a national crisis that requires a national strategy and the Administration should be focused on aiding our state and local governments not cutting funding. https://t.co/hfOVKXJSUv

We must address the disproportionate impact the #coronavirus has had on communities of color especially our children. I am committed to ensuring our communities have the necessary resources to combat the virus and will work to close the gaps in healthcare disparities. https://t.co/J5QaNiOFA5

Amidst the #COVID_19 pandemic 1.2 million children are in need of child care but more than 18000 military children remain on waitlists. That's why I joined 35 of my colleagues in sending a bipartisan letter urging DoD to close child care gaps for military families. https://t.co/Zhc6DwAdbm

Reminder: Next week I will be hosting two #CisnerosInYourCounty Town Halls where I will answer your questions on the #coronavirus.  Residents of #LA and #SanBernardino counties RSVP here: https://t.co/qpOOmTwWhk   Residents of #OrangeCounty RSVP here: https://t.co/oQBrtNTYhv https://t.co/i2gjYnQv7m

Yesterday I joined nearly 70 of my colleagues in a bipartisan call for congressional leadership to provide relief to nonprofits devastated by #COVID_19.  Nonprofits have been working hard to help our communities from the start of this pandemic we cannot leave them behind. https://t.co/lkxzLfc26U

Next week I'm hosting 2 #CisnerosInYourCounty Town Halls for #CA39 residents to provide an update on the #coronavirus.  Residents of #LA and #SanBernardino counties RSVP here: https://t.co/qpOOmTwWhk   Residents of #OrangeCounty RSVP here: https://t.co/oQBrtNTYhv https://t.co/iaxid9JtmF

Millions of Americans have lost their health insurance amid the #coronavirus pandemic. The #HeroesAct includes provisions that would mandate COVID-19-related treatment be free for those with Medicare Medicaid and private insurance. The Senate must act. https://t.co/2x2IOLTjl6

I joined my Republican and Democratic colleagues in signing a letter to Speaker Pelosi and Leader McCarthy urging for the inclusion of provisions to ensure small businesses can maximize their funding from the #PaycheckProtectionProgram in the next #COVID_19 relief package. https://t.co/RmAh5vOe2Z

#ICYMI: I wrote an op-ed on how OCBOE's school reopening recommendations fall short of keeping our students teachers and staff safe. We need to get the coronavirus under control and have a comprehensive safety plan before our schools reopen. https://t.co/4KwSkuvc0r

On August 3rd @SBAgov is hosting an Access Live event for #AAPI Entrepreneurs to learn what opportunities exist to aid small businesses non-profits and faith-based organizations in recovery from #COVID_19. Tune in on their Facebook or watch here: https://t.co/sReuLzvMjF

My colleagues and I sent a bipartisan letter urging House Leadership to include strong funding for the Individuals with Disabilities in Education Act (IDEA) in the next COVID relief package. This funding will ensure that schools can properly support students with disabilities. https://t.co/IB2c7PkMiw

Small businesses in #CA39 and across the US still need relief. I led a bipartisan letter with @RepBalderson urging for the next #coronavirus package to allow small businesses to receive a second #PPP loan. Federal assistance needs to change to reflect the realities on the ground. https://t.co/MdQFG1mpbT

In May I wrote an op-ed calling on Congress to provide funding for our cities devastated by #COVID_19. Over 70 days ago the House passed the #HeroesAct which would provide more than $9 billion to #CA39 cities and counties. The Senate needs to act. https://t.co/IxlrlY2SfQ
Help slow the spread of the coronavirus #MaskUp. #CA39 https://t.co/6R69Da3zPc

Today I voted to pass the first Appropriations funding package. This bill reflects the priorities of #CA39 including funding for wildfire preparedness coronavirus response veterans’ homelessness assistance program Hispanic Serving Institutions and public land protection. https://t.co/fZtD7C2HIn

I’m proud to have voted to pass the bipartisan #NDAA and secure provisions to protect military families strengthen national security improve military diversity and combat COVID-19. This bill puts servicemembers first & reflects the priorities of #CA39. https://t.co/wc4uNjvPST

Instead of working to stop the spread of the coronavirus President Trump is putting his energy into undermining the #Census. This executive order is another blatant backward attempt to depress the number of individuals from getting counted. https://t.co/EwgwQywOmB

The child care sector has been hit hard by the #coronavirus. When parents return to work they'll be relying on this critical service even more. Right now I'm working with my colleagues to ensure the child care sector has the necessary relief to recover. https://t.co/jZ6ufMrbOr

The LA Regional COVID-19 Recovery Fund has begun accepting applications for the second round of grants for small businesses and nonprofits in #LACounty. Learn more about eligibility and apply here: https://t.co/4Np2AmL11m

I'm back in DC this week to vote on the #NDAA which includes my bipartisan bills to protect military families and our environment.  Congress is also working to provide more coronavirus relief and funding for workers small businesses schools and testing. #HeroesAct https://t.co/9AWTe76ob9

The city of #Fullerton has launched Feed Fullerton a #COVID_19 meal assistance program aimed at providing meals from local restaurants to residents who may be struggling during the pandemic. For more info and to apply visit https://t.co/Gb6fC0rgNq https://t.co/3JZK8exXHJ

My colleagues and I sent a letter to @SecAzar calling on the Administration to rescind its harmful new guidance on the reporting of #COVID_19 data which now circumvents the CDC and is sent to HHS instead. The American people need timely and accurate info. https://t.co/2TEVudNWH3

#OrangeCounty's Anaheim Convention Center is hosting a new drive thru #coronavirus testing site in an effort to expand OC's testing capacity.  For more info or to make an appointment visit https://t.co/dC4bZNuZlX or call 800-446-8888. https://t.co/hgzChMSNIi

My OC colleagues and I have been calling on @ochealth to address the testing disparity in #OrangeCounty. We need to expand testing because it's a critical part in keeping #CA39 safe and getting the coronavirus under control. https://t.co/zuGJFepmeK

July is Park and Recreation Month! Join me and @nrpa as we recognize the essential services that park and recreation professionals are providing for our community throughout COVID-19. #WeAreParksAndRec https://t.co/ErpiP2UCaq

It's great to see Orange County's new Latino Health Equity Initiative helping to close the gaps in healthcare disparities in the Latino Community. We must continue to address the disproportionate effects the coronavirus has had on communities of color. https://t.co/PH7cQKAXtE

#ICYMI: On Thursday I held a #CA39 Town Hall with doctors from St.Jude Medical Center the Brea Chamber of Commerce & the CA Public Health Department to answer your questions on the #coronavirus. If you missed it you can watch it on my Facebook page. https://t.co/gH6wRW2Seu

We just wrapped up our 18th #CA39 coronavirus town hall! Thanks to @StJudeMedCenter's Drs. Sajen Matthew and Harry Peled @BreaChamber CEO/President Heidi Gallegos and @CAPublicHealth Chief Deputy Dir. Susan Fanelli for joining me tonight to answer our community's questions. https://t.co/Djl8kt1Lth

Tune in later TODAY at 6 PM PT on my Facebook page. I will be joined by the Brea Chamber of Commerce the California Department of Public Health and doctors from St. Jude's Medical Center to discuss and answer questions submitted on the #coronavirus. https://t.co/VI3T0KJY3y

Tomorrow at 6 PM PT join our #CA39 Facebook Live Town Hall with St. Jude Medical Center doctors the CA Department of Public Health and the Brea Chamber of Commerce to answer your questions on the #coronavirus.   RSVP and submit questions here: https://t.co/Qqt1uZjfEw https://t.co/ilykCAm4YF

The World Health Organization is responsible for coordinating global efforts to fight infectious diseases worldwide including the #coronavirus. Withdrawing from the @WHO in the middle of a pandemic is irresponsible and puts lives at risk. https://t.co/4ZEM3gjCdm

I'm hosting a Facebook Live Town Hall Thursday at 6:00 PM PT to discuss the impacts of #coronavirus in #CA39 and answer your questions.  RSVP and submit questions here: https://t.co/Qqt1uZjfEw https://t.co/Wxo7QDT3od

Independent local restaurants in #CA39 have been hit hard by the #coronavirus.   Today I cosponsored the bipartisan RESTAURANTS Act to provide the certainty stability and relief that our restaurants need and to keep workers employed. https://t.co/HEwhkNtLBT

On Thursday at 6:00 PM I am hosting a #CA39 virtual Facebook Live Town Hall with doctors from St. Jude Medical Center and the Brea Chamber of Commerce to give an update on the #coronavirus.   RSVP and submit questions here: https://t.co/qfgbJVBG2K https://t.co/wJePILxWVr

While we’re working to deal with our current crisis we also need to make sure we’re ready for future crises too. Last night I worked with my HASC colleagues to secure critical provisions in the #NDAA to combat #COVID and prepare for future pandemics. https://t.co/8i7U6Jzx2W

Last week we saw #OrangeCounty's deadliest week related to the #coronavirus and people are still facing obstacles to getting a test.  My OC colleagues and I sent a letter to @ochealth urging to expand testing to ensure public health and safety. https://t.co/7TBaXXmbs1

Small businesses have been devastated by the #coronavirus & the lack of SBA relief disproportionately impacts minority- & locally-owned small businesses.  @RepBalderson and I co-led a bipartisan letter to congressional leadership urging to support CDEs and expand #PPP and #EIDL. https://t.co/YHaSb4oulX

This is alarming. We can't afford to go backwards.  The #HeroesAct makes critical investments in our testing infrastructure including $75 billion for testing contact tracing access to free COVID treatment and support for hospitals. The Senate must act. https://t.co/vgICB0wCxB

My colleagues and I sent a letter to Sec. Mnuchin & Admin. Carranza calling for #PPP disclosure & transparency.   The American people deserve to know where taxpayer-funded coronavirus aid is going and that small business loans are going to who they’re meant for—small businesses. https://t.co/WoPsubitis

#BuenaPark and #Fullerton are receiving over $130000 in #coronavirus aid from the #CARESAct.  But our cities still need more funding. The House passed the #HeroesAct a month ago—which would bring back $9 billion for #CA39 cities and counties. The Senate needs to act. https://t.co/1afzxtcn5M

#DiamondBar small business owners can apply for one-time grants of $5000 from the city to help ease the economic hardships caused by #COVID_19.  Applications open on June 22nd at 9 AM and close at 12 PM on June 24th. More information can be found below: https://t.co/A80uFZL8Iv

Residents of #BuenaPark may qualify for the city's new #COVID_19 Emergency Rental Assistance Program. Applications are not yet open but you can pre-determine your eligibility below. https://t.co/Ng6eGStME1
Attention! @SBAgov has reopened applications for the #EIDL program for small businesses and non-profits impacted by the #coronavirus.   Learn more and apply here: https://t.co/IK0KDlRBKi

#CA39 healthcare workers need masks to provide the necessary testing and services to combat #COVID_19 in our communities.  Today we donated nearly 1000 masks to three CA-39 health providers: @KCSHealthCenter @vcchealthcare and the Family Health Matters Community Health Center. https://t.co/zKJWjRAZEk

#CA is conducting confidential contact tracing to slow the spread of the #coronavirus. This has been used by public health officials for decades to slow the spread of infectious disease. Here's how it works: https://t.co/whQUKUUFjO https://t.co/ZuVad8nTaq

I joined my House and Senate colleagues in urging the Administration to address the needs of nursing home residents and staff as they respond to #COVID_19.  Nursing home residents are among the most vulnerable during this pandemic and they need more federal support. https://t.co/SWHbZO00LS

America is experiencing a time of incredible pain – both as we fight COVID-19 and in the wake of the senseless death of #GeorgeFloyd. Instead of uniting us President Trump is pouring salt on the wounds.  America deserves better.

Over 100000 lives have been lost in this country because of COVID-19. Today we honor them—doctors nurses bus drivers grocery store workers mother fathers siblings friends neighbors and loved ones. Their lives will never be forgotten. #Lament100K #DayOfMourning https://t.co/2HGXu92utm

Thanks to everyone who tuned into our #CA39 virtual roundtable on #COVID19 Impact Resources & the Latino Community. I'm grateful for our panelists for joining me tonight @WeAreUnidosUS's Angelica Sala @OCHCC's Reuben Franco @Building_Skills' Luis Sandoval & @CHIRLA's Agatha So. https://t.co/LceKMpxVXB
Don't forget I'm hosting a virtual roundtable is today at 4pm PT to talk about #COVID19 resources and the Latino Community. You can watch it live on my Facebook. https://t.co/5yQNQq071r

Reminder: My virtual roundtable discussing #COVID_19 and the Latino community is tomorrow at 4pm PT with leaders from @WeAreUnidosUS @OCHCC @Building_Skills and @CHIRLA.  We will be providing in language support please RSVP and submit questions here: https://t.co/3EArPV1koH https://t.co/E7I9gZFeXj

Viernes a las 4pm PT: Voy a tener una mesa redonda virtual sobre #COVID_19 recursos y la comunidad Latino con los líderes de @WeAreUnidosUS @OCHCC @Building_Skills y @CHIRLA.  Vamos a tener apoyo en Español por favor RSVP y enviar preguntas aquí: https://t.co/qJf3sO6gN8

Friday at 4pm PT: I'm hosting a virtual roundtable on #COVID_19 resources and the Latino community with leaders from @WeAreUnidosUS @OCHCC @Building_Skills and @CHIRLA.  In language support will be available please RSVP and submit questions here: https://t.co/3EArPV1koH https://t.co/x98d7fGP5B

This #OlderAmericansMonth we celebrate the contributions seniors have made in our families and communities. As we continue to confront the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure they have the support they need. https://t.co/yyN0QP8ERX

.@Bonnie_at_TAPS: “As survivors of military death we are no strangers to isolation fear and loss; we have many lessons learned and tools for coping. Outreach to families of those who died from the coronavirus is to let them know they are not alone.” https://t.co/XE7Cu9CbCI

I'm leading a bipartisan push for DOD/HHS to use their existing authority to prioritize buying medical supplies from small businesses.  "The goal is to replenish the depleted Strategic National Stockpile & prepare for possible future waves of coronavirus or other disasters" #CA39 https://t.co/qVwOx1Q9Vm

This morning I was grateful to join my @NewDemCoalition colleagues in a call with Dr. Anthony Fauci Director of the @NIAIDNews who shared his perspectives on coronavirus pandemic testing treatment and important considerations as we look to reopen. https://t.co/OIzmvviCsC

Another #CisnerosInYourCity Town Hall done this morning! Thank you to all of the #LaHabra residents who joined me today.  The Town Hall for residents of #RowlandHeights is later today at 4 pm PT be sure to tune in to answer questions about the #coronavirus and our community. https://t.co/PbfvmeNTvC

✅$10 billion for EIDL; and makes necessary fixes and expands the PPP to those that need it including local chambers of commerce and other non-profits ✅Supports essential workers by providing hazard pay and workplace protections ✅Coronavirus testing and treatment
